CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Access to court)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Ján Šikuta;Johannes Silvis;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE he purchased a house and the land on which it was built , located in GPE . The applicant ’s parcel of land was adjacent to a parcel of land purchased by CARDINAL parties in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action against the CARDINAL third parties , seeking to obtain the demarcation of the adjacent parcels of land and an order requiring the defendants to return to him an QUANTITY . m parcel of land which was allegedly being illegally occupied by them .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG held that the defendants had been illegally occupying a parcel of QUANTITY . m of the applicant ’s land since DATE . It established the boundaries of the properties on the basis of a technical report prepared by an expert and ordered the defendants to return the land in question to the applicant .

CARDINAL . The defendants lodged an appeal with ORG . The court ordered a new expert report . On DATE the court dismissed the appeal as ill - founded endorsing the reasoning of the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . The defendants lodged an appeal on points of law on the ground that the courts had misinterpreted the facts and the applicable legal provisions .

CARDINAL . In a final decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG allowed the appeal on points of law , quashed the decisions of the first CARDINAL courts and dismissed the applicant ’s action . It held that both the applicant and the defendants had in their possession smaller areas of land than those mentioned in their respective contracts of acquisition , and invited the parties to reach a friendly settlement . It also held that the parties could bring a fresh action only if they could not reach an agreement .
